###  [Dr. Karina Rodriguez Echavarria]((https://research.brighton.ac.uk/en/persons/karina-rodriguez-echavarria))

Reader, at the School of Architecture, Engineering and Technology

- Computer Science as first degree, and PhD in Engineering.
- Researcher on Visual Computing and Cultural Heritage


### Leadership roles
Various leadership roles in the scholarly community researching in Virutal Environments: 

- Co-Lead for University of Brighton's [Computing and Mathematical Sciences Research Excellence Group](https://research.brighton.ac.uk/en/organisations/computing-and-mathematical-sciences-research-excellence-group)
- Project Lead for the UK-Research and Innovation (UKRI) funded projects
   - Crafting a Sustainable Future: Empowering Indian Crafts in the Creative Industries.
  - [A Roadmap for a National Training Centre on Multidimensional Digital Media in the Arts and Humanities](https://culturedigitalskills.org/)
  - [Scoping future data services for the arts and humanities.](https://blogs.brighton.ac.uk/3ddataservice/)
- Chair for [Eurographics' Workshops Board](https://www.eg.org/wp/about-eg/working-groups/) which organises more than 10 events across various areas of computer graphics including Virtual Environments, High-Performance Graphics and Rendering. See [associated publications](https://diglib.eg.org/) of these events to learn more about this research. 
- Chair of the [Steering Comittee, Eurographics Working group of Computer Graphics and Cultural Heritage](https://diglib.eg.org/communities/33bc9cd7-e2be-4a28-b70f-5af1a46c4bfb), which organises events with researchers interested in Virtual Environments for Visualisation of heritage content and other creative ways to interact with history.
- Editor-in-Chief for the [ACM Journal of Computing and Cultural Heritage (JOCCH)](https://jocch.acm.org/), which publishes a wide range of material in [mixed/augumented reality systems](https://dl.acm.org/topic/ccs2012/10003120.10003121.10003124.10010392?SeriesKey=jocch&expand=all).
